Class DistanceVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • DistanceVector

  • public class DistanceVector
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of the Distance Vector Algorithm
    Version:
    CS 3700 HW10
    Author:
    Neal Friedman and William Holden

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DistanceVector()
      Constructor for Distance Vector Algorithm Application

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void distanceVectorAlgorithm(int[][] cd, int[][] sv, int[][] nv, int eventNum)
      This method performs the distance vector algorithm on a given set of tables.
      static int[][] getCostData()
      Scans in a file stored in the source directory named 'cost.txt' and then creates a table out of the data representing neighboring node id in the left column and link cost in the right column.
      static int[][] getNeighborVectorData(int n)
      Scans in a file stored in the source directory named 'neighbor_vectors.txt' and then creates a table out of the data representing the topology of the network.
      static int[][] getSourceVectorData(int n)
      Scans in a file stored in the source directory named 'source_vectors.txt' and then creates a table out of the data representing the distance vectors in the first row and the corresponding link vectors in the second row.
      static int pickEvent()
      Asks the user to select a specific event
      static void printTable(int[][] a)
      Takes a 2d array and prints it to the console
      void start()
      Start the application

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the application

      • getCostData

        public static int[][] getCostData()
        Scans in a file stored in the source directory named 'cost.txt' and then creates a table out of the data representing neighboring node id in the left column and link cost in the right column.
        Returns:
        Returns a table of the cost data.

      • getSourceVectorData

        public static int[][] getSourceVectorData(int n)
        Scans in a file stored in the source directory named 'source_vectors.txt' and then creates a table out of the data representing the distance vectors in the first row and the corresponding link vectors in the second row.
        Parameters:
        n - The total number of routers.
        Returns:
        Returns a table of with the source vector data.

      • getNeighborVectorData

        public static int[][] getNeighborVectorData(int n)
        Scans in a file stored in the source directory named 'neighbor_vectors.txt' and then creates a table out of the data representing the topology of the network. x values in the first column on the left, Dx[0]... Dx[n] in the following columns.
        Parameters:
        n - The total number of routers.
        Returns:
        Returns a table with the neighbor vector data.

      • pickEvent

        public static int pickEvent()
        Asks the user to select a specific event
        Returns:
        eventNumber Returns the event number chosen by the user

      • printTable

        public static void printTable(int[][] a)
        Takes a 2d array and prints it to the console
        Parameters:
        a - A table to print

      • distanceVectorAlgorithm

        public static void distanceVectorAlgorithm(int[][] cd,
                                           int[][] sv,
                                           int[][] nv,
                                           int eventNum)
        This method performs the distance vector algorithm on a given set of tables.
        Parameters:
        cd - The cost data table
        sv - The source vector table
        nv - The neighbor vector table
        eventNum - the event number chosen by the user
